about_the_game:
Experience the sound of Endling - Extinction is Forever with the memorable score from award-winning film composer Manel Gil-Inglada. Deeply emotional, sometimes delicate, generally very intense and disturbing, and always with a very organic character.



It's focused on a few major main themes: "In a Not so Distant Future", a dramatic theme that reflects environmental destruction, how far humans have come in their desire to overexploit the planet's natural resources, and how this has wiped out the vast majority of plant and animal species. "Shelter", or the delicate "Fox Family" theme with all its variations, represents their fragile survival in this world devastated by humans, where each cub embodies a musical instrument that will only play if it remains alive. Narration and emotion to give the characters a "soul" and try to empathize with the player in their mission to save the cubs from all the dangers that surround them.



With a lot of other themes assigned to the different characters and situations that appear throughout the game and all its variations, blending on numerous occasions. A soundtrack in which Gil-Inglada has featured two great soloists: Tina Guo on Cello and Rusanda Panfili on Violin.

Original Score Composed and Performed by Manel Gil-Inglada
Cello performed by Tina Guo
Violin performed by Rusanda Panfili
Vocals performed by Jùlia Vila Chiapella
Recorder performed by Pablo Rodríguez-Tembleco
"Radio Cubandrone" and "Radio Indie" Composed by Pablo Rodríguez-Tembleco
Score Mixed and Mastered by Joan Barranca at Gravitymusic.tv
detailed_description:
Check out our upcoming game Oddsparks


Explore a strange fantasy world, uncover the mysteries of the past, automate your workshops, and go on adventures with your odd & adorable Sparks!

Oddsparks: An Automation Adventure is a blend of Automation and Real Time Strategy for single-player and online co-op. We made it for both the die-hard fans of the Automation genre and the Automation-curious!

About the Game

Experience the sound of Endling - Extinction is Forever with the memorable score from award-winning film composer Manel Gil-Inglada. Deeply emotional, sometimes delicate, generally very intense and disturbing, and always with a very organic character. It's focused on a few major main themes: "In a Not so Distant Future", a dramatic theme that reflects environmental destruction, how far humans have come in their desire to overexploit the planet's natural resources, and how this has wiped out the vast majority of plant and animal species. "Shelter", or the delicate "Fox Family" theme with all its variations, represents their fragile survival in this world devastated by humans, where each cub embodies a musical instrument that will only play if it remains alive. Narration and emotion to give the characters a "soul" and try to empathize with the player in their mission to save the cubs from all the dangers that surround them. With a lot of other themes assigned to the different characters and situations that appear throughout the game and all its variations, blending on numerous occasions.
